column5: Looking for last week Sept bear hunt and fishing, prefer less than 14-15 hr drive from Cleveland Oh area, any thoughts? Thanks
O'Sullivan's Rainbow, on O'Sullivan Lake used to offer bear hunting, donno if Bob still does. Good fishing, remote drive-in. Bill
Try Matt at Crawford's Camp in Sioux Narrows, he does both and he and his wife run a first class operation !!

Bill this is the bear outfitter that use to do O'sullivans, they now bought a place on the river going into OShttps://www.andomoozweoutfitters.com...bear_hunt.html WE are looking at this place, close enough not too far

It's a little further than you want to drive, but give Ian at Five Lakes Lodge(Red Lake) a call. Great guy, great lodge, great fishing, and I know he does Bear hunts as well. That time of year you may even be able to throw grouse hunting into the fray in the evenings if you're interested, world class grouse hunting up there! I'm honestly not sure if he runs his bear hunts out of his main lodge or if they fly out for those, but call him and he'll talk your ear off about hunting lol.Great time of year to be on Gull Rock lake as well, you'll have the lake basically to yourself and the big pike will be hungry!Here's the info: https://fivelakeslodge.com/packages/...nting-package/

I'd say Sunset Lodge on Red Lake, ON but i don't know how fast you drive. might exceed your 15 hr limiit, LOL. Have you looked into going to Wisconson? they have many walleye options and sometimes i see more bears while driving through WI than i do on the 502. Have fun with your search and good luck!
